abstract.text: GCBuzzKeySDK is a framework that provides functionalities for custom keyboard integration in iOS applications with dynamic hotkeys powered by your backend APIs. The SDK handles:

inlineContent.text: An example of a Hotkey could be a payments hotkey which handles screens related to payments, such as displaying payment options, processing transactions, and showing transaction history. Another example could be a beneficiary hotkey that manages screens for adding, viewing, and managing beneficiaries. Based on the requirements and backend APIs the hotkeys can be customized to provide relevant functionalities to users. Designs and API contracts have to be agreed upon before implementation.
To integrate the GCBuzzKeySDK into your iOS application, follow these steps:
Add a custom keyboard target to your iOS application. This can be added from Xcode by selecting File > New > Target and choosing “Custom Keyboard Extension” from the list of available templates.

Add the GCBuzzKeySDK framework to your custom keyboard target. You can do this by dragging and dropping the framework into your Xcode project and ensuring it is included in the “Link Binary With Libraries” section of your keyboard target’s build phases. Make sure that the framework is added with ‘Do not embed’ option.
Add the supporting GCKeyboardKitSDK.framework and GCPredicts.framework as well to the keyboard extension target with the ‘Do not embed’ option.
Add Associated Domains capability to both the main app target and keyboard extension target. In the Associated Domains section, add the following entry:
. This is required for deeplinking support.

. This allows the keyboard to have full access to network resources.

This class will handle deeplink from keyboard to App using URL scheme
